717446f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 39th Street
717446f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from 39th Street. At the left is
the Metropolitan Opera House. In the centre is the Broadway
Theatre, on the site of the future Bricken-Textile Building.
Above the theatre, the New York Times Building is nearing completion.
At the extreme right is the Astor Hotel.
1904.
Brown Brothers.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717437f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 39th Street
717437f-a.text:

717452f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 39th Street
717452f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, north from, but not including, 39th Street.
In the centre, the 33-story Bricken-Textile Building is nearing
completion.
August 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, seven months later. The Bricken-Textile Building is
now completed. The flags are at half-staff in mourning for Chief
.Justice and former President William Howard Taft, who was succeeded
on the Supreme Court by Charles Evans Hughes.
March 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717453f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 39th Street
717453f-b.text:
Broadway, east side, from 39th to 42nd Streets. The large
buildings are the Lefcourt-Manhattan and the Central National Bank.
Beyond the latter may be seen the Hotel Continental undergoing
demolition.
March 10, 1930.
L. Sperr.

717440f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 39th Street
717440f-a.text:
Booadway at 39th Street. In the foreground, on the S.E. corner,
is the clearing on the site of the Casino Theatre. Diagonally
opposite, on the N.W. corner, is the Metropolitan Opera House,
while on the right, or the N.E. cornbr, is the Lefcourt-Manhattan
Buildins.
March 10, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

ho new building was designed by the Offces of Irwin S. Chanin, Architect,

The new building, to contain about l-udllion square feet of office and

717457f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - 39th Street
717457f-a.text:
od2
Broad vay, east side, from 40th to 39th Streets. This corner
building contains a salohn operated by Kid Ac Coy, of pugilistic fame,
the innventor of the iustly celebrated corkscrew punch, which is a
blow struck in the prize ring, and not a cocktail. fhis building,
and the Empire Theatre, which adjoins it, will still etand in 1936.
THe corner building, however, will be replaced by the Lefcourt-Manhattan
Building, and the Casino Theatre below it, will give way to the
Bricken-Casino Building.
About 1900.
International News.
